head.title: Raise the Gas Tax, Save the Planet

hedline.hl1: Raise the Gas Tax, Save the Planet

block.p: I strongly agree with Thomas L. Friedman that we need a 50-cents-a-gallon gasoline tax and that its revenues should be used to create a national program to develop renewable energy sources.
We desperately need this for our national security and to save the planet.

Like Mr. Friedman, though, I don't believe that the Bush administration is about to propose anything of the sort. But beyond that, I don't think there's a ghost of a chance that any Democrat would, either.
And any third-party candidate in 2008 with such a plan would immediately be dismissed as a bothersome distraction and fraud, no matter his or her credentials.
Still, the notion that our leaders might take bold action to address a threat far greater than terrorism is such a pleasant fantasy that I encourage Mr. Friedman to keep writing about the subject.
But a substantial tax on gasoline is unimaginable now, given the decrepitude of our political system.
